p: Further analyses of the 239 imported cases of dengue revealed that 142 of the infected individuals (59.4%) were Taiwanese nationals who had traveled abroad. However, foreign workers and tourists entering the country accounted for a further 15.5 and 8.8% of cases, respectively (Table 2). Analysis of patient occupation is presented in Table 3, with home management, business, and studying being the most commonly cited occupations (together accounting for 46.4% of cases). Figure 1 shows fluctuations in the monthly reporting rates of imported cases of dengue in Kaohsiung City (Fig. 1).
